36636149.review:
[h1][b]          Se arrisque e pontue[/b][/h1]

[b]          Superflight[/b] é um game indie de wingsuit, simples, diferente e interessante. Apesar da simplicidade, o jogo consegue ser divertido, desafiador e possuir belos cenários, com um conceito artístico muito criativo.

          O objetivo é [b]voar e se arriscar em manobras[/b] para conseguir a melhor pontuação, ganhando rank e desbloqueando [b]conquistas[/b] que são muito bem boladas e divertidas de se alcançar. Os mapas são gerados aleatoriamente, todos são bem diferentes um do outro.

          Ao longo das manobras, portais podem ser encontrados, ao entrar em um portal, o jogador é teleportado para um novo mapa e ganha 1000 pontos por isso, há outras formas de mudar o mapa, descendo o mais baixo possível ou gerando um novo lugar pelo menu do jogo, também é possível jogar cenários de outros jogadores, colando o nome do mapa gerado no menu.

          A jogabilidade de [b]Superflight[/b] no começo é bem complicada, mas com uns minutos de gameplay tudo fica familiar e o domínio dos controles vai acontecendo. Podemos apenas ir para cima, lado esquerdo, lado direito e para baixo.

[b]          Uma trilha sonora é o que mais faz falta no jogo[/b], já que o mesmo não possui, os únicos sons presentes são dos pontos que vamos alcançando, do vento e da batida (morte) caso aconteça.

          Em termos gráficos, como já foi citado, o game é [b]simples e aposta em um estilo artístico minimalista[/b], que funciona muito bem, o resultado sem dúvidas é incrível, aliás, muitas vezes a morte in-game acontece pelo fato de perder o foco por conta dos belos cenários que com certeza todos que jogaram ou jogarão, já apreciaram ou irão apreciar.

[*][h1][b]Pontos positivos:[/b][/h1]
[*]Cenários simples e bonitos
[*]Boa jogabilidade
[*]Conquistas desafiadoras
[*]Classificação Steam
[*]Divertido e relaxante
[*]Preço acessível

[*][h1][b]Pontos negativos:[/b][/h1]
[*]Não possui trilha sonora

[quote][i]Análise escrita para o curador [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/cacadoresdeconquistas#curation]Caçadores de Conquistas[/url].[/i][/quote]

36635929.review:
It doesn't take a lot of time to get what Superflight is all about.  There are no bad guys, evil creatures, or even a story (though one wouldn't be hard-pressed to come up with some sort of lofty analogy to describe on Polygon for back-patting fun); it's just a boxy sort of creature weaving around, over, under and through surreal landscapes as it fights the ever-constant pull of gravity.

The joy of the game, then, is in its precise controls and the sheer thrill of threading the proverbial needle as you navigate the twists and turns of rocky crevices, looking for that perfect score run or simply just looking to survive as long as you can.  On the surface, the quest of getting useless points and seeing where you rank with every other yahoo that's been playing Superflight seems a little lacklustre, but once the game gets moving (and it takes seconds to get going), you begin to understand just how GrizzlyGames beaded in on a very singular focus and made it exhilirating to play.  The boxy-looking thing (seriously, it's not a guy) moves exactly as you think it ought to and that's what makes Superflight an instant hit.  The folks at Grizzly knew exactly what they wanted to do and executed it almost flawlessly.

Starting high above a randomly-generated environment which is typically rocky and scraggly (craggly? jagged?), you navigate your winged creature with just the stick.  There's no propulsion so you are at the mercy of gravity and physics and it feels oh-so-good.  The ultimate goal of the game is simply to score as many points as you can as you make your descent and cash them in before you face-plant into a rocky wall.  You do this by flying as close as you possibly can to the landscape - a vertical playground of crevices, nooks, crannies, and holes - and the longer you can keep doing it, the bigger the combo you an create.  Special moves like skimming a wall to the point of making the character model go berserk or just squeezing through a very tight space or a hole nets you big point bonuses.  Any time you catch some free air away from the structure, the points cash in and you're free to start another combo.  Obviously you want to maintain the longest combo you can, but get too greedy and you'll fly right into an inescapable cave and your score will amount to nothing.  If you manage to make it to the bottom, you can either aim yourself through a portal to get to a new world for a few points or simply dive into the mists and achieve the same result (no score bonus here).  That's it.

What Superflight really excels at is risk-reward.  Few things are as satisfying as committing to a blind crevice at an insane dive and somehow making it out of there without a scratch.  You can just as easily spiral around the outside of the landscape, but it's boring and you'll score very little.  At first, it can be tempting to simply do that if only because you'll find your life expectancy much greater, but inevitably, those teeny tiny gaps are going to call out to you and you're going to grow a pair and go for it (I'm talking about the game here).  After a rocky start (*snort*), soon enough you'll be threading the needle and just taking stupid risks just for the hell of it.  With the sound design blowing the wind and the camera shaking as you gain speed, there's a nice visceral tangibility to the whole experience.

As far as frustration goes, it mostly stems from the level generator.  No matter what the map is, there's a certain visual language that you'll come to understand in that there are certain queues which the generator is prone to putting into the map that say things like "there's a crevice here," or "there's a hole here".  Or at least that's what it would be, but there's a small chance that it's a complete and total lie.  I've ruined a few good runs flying right into a spot that should have had an exit, but didn't, where had it been a human hand crafting that space, it's certain there would have been one.  It makes taking those risky dives or turns even moreso because there's just no guarantee that there's a light at the end of the tunnel.  The other thing that happens quite a bit, though it has been dialed back in a few patches (still present as of this writing) is when you enter a new map via portal or falling through the bottom and you're basically careening into a wall or a flat plain.  There's nothing you can do at that point.  Crash and burn, Mav.  Crash and burn.

All that being said, Superflight is a game that gives you what you put into it.  It can be a relaxing gliding sim or it can be a vicious adrenaline trigger.  It can be a pleasant distraction or an addicting obsession.  It can be both.  However you approach it, you probably can't say that you haven't spent more on worse.  This is a game worth putting into your library.

36635365.review:
Superflight is the type of game I had no idea I wanted until I gave it a shot. Whether you want a relaxing time flying lazily around, want to reach high speeds with adrenaline inducing turns and close calls with obstacles, or want to find the perfect level for getting large combos, you’ll find what you’re looking for. The procedural level generation is really well done to the point that some of the levels you will come across feel handcrafted, the levels are full of beautiful colors, and there is an immensely great feeling of speed that can be difficult to portray in video games; all of this for an incredibly reasonable price.

There are certainly features, game modes, customizations, and other things that could be added to make the game even better, but I certainly consider Superflight to be enjoyable and worth your attention.

Das ist schade, denn grundsätzlich ist die Idee einfach frei zu schweben grandios! Das Spiel könnte richtig Spaß machen, wenn man einfach gechillt durch die Lüfte segeln könnte und abwechslungsreiche Levels erkunden könnte. Leider klappt das nicht. Obwohl die Steuerung sehr einfach gehalten ist, sorgen sobald man den Objekten näher kommt seltsame Luftverwirbelungen für z. T. völlig planloses Rumsegeln. Das nervt. Dann bummst man wieder wo gegen und kann das Level von vorn anfangen. Klar - draufgehen macht nix aus - man segelt ja gleich wieder los. Aber gerade nah an Objekte ranzufliegen ist so meines Erachten eher vom Zufall als vom Können abhängig. Mich hat die Steuerung und der wahllose Strömungsabriss schon nach kurzer Zeit in den Wahnsinn getrieben. Das Spiel verfehl so den Charakter zu entspannen und abzuchillen, genauso wie die Levels noch mehr zu erkunden. Grade damit hätte es aber in meinen Augen punkten können. So möchte es zum Punktesammlen animieren, was aber eher frustig ist und nervt. Dazu kommt, dass es bei mir auch noch beim Laden von Maps hängen bleibt und die Levels dann doch weniger abwechslungsreich sind als gedacht. Die Levels unterscheiden sich nur durch die Anordnung der wahllos zusammengewürfelten Klotzchen in verschiedensen Farben. Auch der eigene Wingsuite-Avatar sieht mir doch etwas zu sehr danach aus, als hätte jemand sehr grobmotorisch einige Holzbretter zu einer grade so menschlich aussehenden Figur zusammengetackert... 
Menno! Da wäre mehr drin gewesen. Vielleicht feilen die Entwickler ja nochmal an der Steuerung, dann wäre das echt ne hübsche Nummer...

Wow. Just wow. It is so easy to see why reviwers are raving about this game. They have captured the 'feel' that there were obviously aiming for 100%. The control of your avatar just feels natural. This really is one of those games that you can pick up in seconds, but take years to master. I wish so much that there was a VR mode as it seems like it would be a perfect fit.

I have been playing this game in Virtual Desktop on an Oculus Rift. Pair that with some relaxing music and this becomes a true assult on your senses. When you pull off a big combo it feels a little like the old days of Tony Hawks, only distilled down to something even more pure.

Only cons are...
- No VR support, but that obviously affects very few people anyway
- Lack of ingame soundtrack - But hey it's easy to play your own

Could be improved with...
- Multiplayer hot-seat mode... Where you all fly the same seris of 4-5 maps and battle for the highest score. This would work oer the internet too. This game feels so good that I just want all my friends to experience it too.

Bottom line...
Buy it now, it would be a steal at 4x its current price. I really hope the developers have a financial success with this game, they fully deserve it for what they have created.

I don't normally review games even exceptional ones, but this one is such a great experience.

The game feels hard at first, then I noticed there's no time limit so I find an open space and practice.
Pretty soon I'm used to how my little sky diver handles, how to prevent stalling, how to gliiiiide. The game is now becoming fun but frustrating I keep dieing. Restart takes a second but is frustrating none the less.

SEVERAL Hours later......
I have discovered "zen mode" check the box and scores are no longer displayed untill the run is over.
I am not playing a game anymore, I am flying my wingsuit over seemingly infinate random terrain, the world outside my window does not exist, time is not even a real dimension anymore, I see a hole in a wall I gliiiiiide through, a wall suprises me I drop under. It has a  long underbelly I skim as close as I dare and drop into cloud. Shortly after, I crash, it's bedtime,

Summery
Incredibly relaxing at times!
Really fast and exciting at times!
I love it
My mate loves it
Play to suit your mood, have fun know your limits,
if it gets frustrating have a cup of tea come back later and your still hooked!

36618462.review:
滑空する。ただそれだけのゲーム。
マップにあるのは宙に浮く島だけ。壁や地面ギリギリを掠めるとポイントが入る。
とは言ったものの、ポイントは非表示に出来るし、ただ滑空しているだけで楽しいゲーム。
少しでも物に触れるとクラッシュしてしまう。

マップは小さく、外に行こうとすると押し戻される。下方に行くと次の島に移動する。
1クラッシュのスコアアタックがあるが、安全に飛行し続けていればスコアは無限に稼げるのであまり意味はない。
島の形は適当な文字列から生成される。ずっと同じ島を飛ぶことも出来るし、ランダムに探検することも出来る。

バツイチコントローラに対応している。アナログスティックで方向操作。Aで決定・リトライ。それだけ。

スコアを気にせず、ランダム生成される地形を気まぐれに飛び回るのが楽しい。速度を上げて飛べば風を感じる。
気づいたら時間が過ぎている。
洞窟を通り抜けようと入ったが、行き止まりで死ぬこともしばしば。

マップが狭く、長時間滑空するためには何度も切り返す必要がある。直線的で滑空し続けるモードがあったら良かった。

36602008.review:
Eigentlich sollten dem erfahrenen Steam-User hier alle Alarmglocken angehen: Indie, prozedural generierte Welt und fast, ja fast kostenlos, da wurden wir doch alle schon zu oft mit unfertigem, langweiligen oder verbuggtem Kram ver*****t und sind evtl auf das ein oder andere FreeToPlay-PayToWin-Konzept reingefallen.
Doch dann kommt gefühlt aus dem Nichts Superflight... 
Ein super Spiel, leicht zu spielen, schwer zu meistern. Motiviert aus sich selbst heraus, weil man einfach wissen will ob man durch diese Lücke im Fels durchfliegen kann. Keine Ingamekäufe, das Spielkonzept kann man jedem in 30 Sekunden erklären und es ist einfach ein Spiel das nicht nur süchtig macht, wie lootinglastige Spiele, sondern es macht einfach Spaß. Punkt. Hätte entsprechend das High-Score-System gar nicht gebraucht, aber wer gerne wissen will wie man im Vergleich zum Rest der Welt steht. 
Und dann das ganze für 3 €? Absolute Kaufempfehlung! Dieses Spiel alleine gibt dem ganzen Indie-Genre schon seine Daseinsberechtigung.

36582587.review:
In this game, you'll crash once, but then immediately understand the game, and then it only gets more fun from there.

Pro's
+ Cool graphics
+ Extremely satisfying gameplay and "game feel"
+ Not over priced
+ Doesn't get boring fast (played it for nearly an hour straight)
+ Cool procedural generation of worlds

Con's
- Would be nice to have more camera control
- Some of the worlds generate in colours that are near impossible to see through
- Deceptively small world (Looks bigger in pictures, invisible walls make it a lot smaller, but not too small)

Genuinely an all round good game. It's fun. It doesn't take itself too seriously. It's pleasant to look at. It costs 2 pounds. Absolutely worth it, tbh I'd happily pay at least 5 pounds for this. Maybe 10 if there was a little more to the game content-wise.

I've only played for a little while, as of now a little under 2hours. And its been a huge blast, It has a very simple style, but alot of the "worlds" that I've been in has truely been stunning, wich might have been because of the faceplant into the side of a wall, but jokes a side, most of the time ive played was spent staying on mostly one "world" and just trying to get a close to perfect rute of it including going trough loops etc. and that in it self was pretty amazing, mastering close turns and trough tight holes (No joke intended)

But truely, the beauty of the game is that once you leave one world, you usually come to a completely diffrent one, that you know close to nothing about, judging wich risks to take is almost if not as important as actually doing them. My current last (and best) run gave me 130'000 points, placeing me in rank 390, and the feeling of acomplishing that was basically the best feeling I've got from a game. the feeling of mastering something (I'm in no shape or form a master, by any means) but you know the feeling.  Never got it form other hard games (Dark Souls etc.)

Saw this game on Draegast's video. kind of fell in love with the game.

36577347.review:
Super flight Is awesome.

I am a huge fan of freedom of movement in games, it has always something that made me feel good, and this game does such a wonderful job of that, the closer you fly to terrain the move you rack up points.

The game is very easy and quick to learn, and It is my current go to game for when im just stressed or need to feel relaxed.

I do not have any real complaints about this game, though I do feel like it would benifit from being able to save previous maps youve been in instead of just the one you are currently in. Also if you could close the wingsuit I feel like that would add some awesome variety to some of the stunts you could pull off.

Normally I would make a pros and cons list and compare it to some other games, but I do not feel that would be fair to a game that is 2.99 and stands pretty much on its own and does not try to extend itself past just being fun (which I would say is a great thing.) All and all I would very highly recommend this game.

36565777.review:
I had no idea how much I needed this game.

I live in a house with 8 other guys and I set up my steam link downstairs on our TV.  I started playing this game and just got lost.  I have my turntable hooked up to our stereo and there is nothing better than playing some super flight and listening to some wax after a long day at work.  My roommates play it for hours when I am not home.  We all love it.  A perfect game to relax and unwind.  There is a thrill to nailing that turn and soaring into a slipstream.  I think maybe the biggest joke and buzzword in recent gaming memory is "procedurally generated".  After a certain space game that term became a joke. Merely a marketing term.  I am not sure what witchcraft GrizzlyGames used, but the levels are always fresh and always unique.  We have played close to 60 hours and have yet to see a similar map.  The controls are tight, the sound design is wonderful, and the visuals are aesthetically pleasing.  All in all absolutely superb, best 2.99 I have ever spent.

36561075.review:
Couple things I recommend adding before review. 
-The ability to control with the mouse, this would be amazing
-First person camera
-Way to check the leaderboard
-Mod support (Steam workshop)
-VR support (I don't have VR yet, but my friend does and this would be amazing!)
 This is a lot to ask of a team of 3 people making their first game, I wouldn't expect this stuff to be added any time soon.

 Endless fun, at a super cheap price!

 The sound of the wind, the shake of the camera, it is all amazing, and the control, after some practice is amazing. I do recommend a controller though, as it is much easier to control with a joystick.

 I'm gonna compare the feeling of flying in this game to swinging around in Spider-Man 2 PS2, the feeling of building up speed and doing quick maneuvers is just so satisfying.

 Tip: If you fly straight down into the void, you get teleported to a new level like a portal, and you don't lose any points. (Although, you get +1000 for using portals!)

High Score: 108579 / Combo: 97043

 Also GrizzlyGames if you're reading this, ignore the negative reviews, the issues they mention are totally false. For example the losing control and getting pulled down, that's simply gravity and momentum, nothing wrong with that.

36558372.review:
Both fun and relaxing. The perfect game to play when you are exhausted, or when you want to listen to podcasts while playing without getting distracted.

The controls are responsive, there are virtually no loadtimes, and the visuals are simple but pleasing. The sound of the wind is a nice touch too. It's a nice flying experience.

My only critique is that the worlds are too small. I would rather fly through a map that generated terrain continously. If it's not possible to generate worlds in that way (or create bigger worlds), I think the developers should implement another kind of portal below each map that transport you to the beginning of the map (in Zen mode, so players can't get a huge highscore by exploiting maps). In short, I want a more seamless experience.

Nevertheless, I recommend this game.

[h1]Buy it, Try it, Don't like it? Refund it.[/h1]

My Opinions:

What it's missing:

36551932.review:
Great game, very cheap timekiller, for the price of ~1 TF2 key you can't really go wrong.

PROS:
+ Beautiful landscapes
+ Performance is very good, if you struggle to get frames you can lower a lot of settings and still get a good looking game without losing a lot of quality
+ Seed generator is a lot of fun for generating consistent worlds
+ Very cheap

CONS:
- Controls can feel a little laggy, but you'll get used to them
- No tutorial, you're on your own to some extent (arrow keys for movement, space restarts current map, escape for menu)
- Video settings revert themselves to default every time you start up.
- Hitboxes for portals are odd / don't line up


Still some work to be done, but it's already fairly polished.

36546412.review:
Flying with a wingsuit has never been better. The only real goal in this game is to earn points by flying dangerously (i.e. getting close to and flying through things), but your otherwise free to fly through a near infinite amount of procedurally generated levels of varying design.

Controls are very tight and satisfying (though wierdly you have to select things with square/x, which also resets your position, and pause with r2/rt. Not sure what mouse/keyboard controls would be).

Aesthetically, it's very minimalistic, with everything including yourself being made of blocks. It's very easy on the eyes, though there are levels generated that have awful colors (bright green & pinkish-purple for example, the kind of crap colors you'd see in really old games).

Sound is okay. There's no music at all which is a bummer. The only bad part is the sound made when your earning points as it gets annoying really quick, though you can either turn off the sound or switch to zen mode which turns off the point display and sound, though you still earn them. 

This is a great game, more than worth the asking price. Que up some easy-listening tunes, and you've got gold.

Overall, an 8.5/10 and easily a contender for being the best indie GOTY.

[h1][i]SUPER-FLIGHT[/i][/h1]

제목처럼 그저 비행하는 게임이다.
[u]이 게임의 목적은 도전과제 혹은 랭킹을 제외하고는 아무것도 없다.[/u]

처음 실행하였을 때 다소 조작이 불편한점이 있었지만, 시간이 흐르며 점점 익숙해졌다. 무엇보다 이 게임은 글라이더를 타고 하강하는 것이라고 생각하고 비행을 하게 되면 보다 더 컨트롤이 수월해진다. 웬만하면 w키와 화살표 위방향 키에서 손을 떼고 상승하려 하지마라.

나는 이 게임을 힐링게임으로 분류하고 싶다.
앞서 언급한 목적없이 그저 날아다니는게 끝이라는 점이 이 게임의 단점이지만 또한 아주 강력한 장점이라고 생각한다.
여지것 이게임 저게임 공포게임을 제외한 장르를 가리지 않고 게임을 해오면서, 이렇게까지 카타르시스를 느끼게 해주는 게임은 이 게임이 처음이었다.
이 게임이 압도적으로 긍정적인 이유는 아마 다들 나와 같은 감정을 느꼇기 때문이라고 생각한다.

[b]정말로 이 게임을 개발한 분들께 진심으로 감사를 표한다.[/b]

36540415.review:
I really like this game. 

The concept is simple: Glide around the map, gaining points for being near objects without hitting them. You gain more points the closer you are to an object, and even more points when there's multiple walls near you. When you're bored of the map, glide into a portal for a new proceduarally generated map.

The controls are easy to learn and very tight. I used a controller, and the left joystick is all you need to control your character.

The graphics are basic, but it works well for this kind of game. The lighting and fog are great and can really change the feeling of the map.

The sound is alright, but nothing special. My biggest issue with the game is that the trailers made me think that there was peaceful ambient music playing while you glide through maps, but there actually isn't any soundtrack in the game. If I could ask for one thing, it would be a soundtrack similar to the music played in the trailers.

一時間ほどプレイした者です。
ゲームとしてはフライングスーツを着てスカイダイビングをするゲームで
地表ギリギリを飛ぶとスコアが入り始め、小さな隙間を通り抜けたり、
ほんの数ミリのところをかすめるとさらにボーナスポイントがもらえます。
その連続最高ポイントと、生きている間に稼いだ累計ポイントで記録がつき、ランキングで競い合うことができます。
ですが普通に飛んでいるだけでも風切り音と高速で落ちていく爽快感、
ギリギリを飛び抜けるドキドキ感などスコアにとらわれずに楽しむこともできます。

ゲームの値段自体300円前後なのでPUBGの箱やスキン売ったお金でも使って買ってみてください、おすすめです。

36527457.review: Superflight is a great idea for a game and not a great game. The infinite number of "maps" you can play in are very, very tiny. There's no flying out to an infinite horizon full of new geometry. You run into invisible walls if you try and go too far in any direction other than down. It loads a new "map" if you go downward long enough. And you're gliding, not flying. There's no boost, no brake, no turn-sharpening mechanics, and really very little control over the player character. Your momentum is always being reduced by some unseen force and all the while you're punished both for slowing down and speeding up. And if you touch any of the geometry your character will explode and the "map" will reset. It's about as relaxing as Super Meat Boy (not the least bit relaxing) but not nearly as well balanced. Futility is baked into every aspect of Superflight. Fun isn't. Luckily its price is also cheap.

36525990.review:
I'm loving the Zen of this. I originally thought I'd give it a quick try and just refund it if it was awful - but it's definitely not.

It is very simple in concept. You are a blocky character in a wingsuit, and you appear in the air above procedurally generated blocky floating islands. You rack up a score by flying dangerously and not crashing. That's about the extent of it.

What that doesn't tell you is that it's oddly relaxing. It shouldn't be. It should be frustrating as hell, and exactly the sort of game that I hate... but it isn't. It's one of those games you can turn off your upper-brain for and play on instinct.

It's not perfect, but for the price, it's well worth a try if you're even remotely thinking about it. A controller is recommended, but not required. I found the game much more enjoyable with one.

Some of the flaws... well, the graphics are pretty blocky. That's fine, as it's part of the art style - but some more variation would be nice. It's also often hard to figure out how close you are to a wall. You do get a shadow, but you don't get any indication for horizontal closeness. Diffuse shadows to either side could potentially help here without breaking anything.

The maps themselves are a bit hit and miss. They're procedural, after all. Your score can skyrocket based on the random map you happen to get, or you could splat into the ground the instant you spawn into a new one. (Rare, but it has happened).

But, flaws aside, it's a great - and fun - game, and definitely well worth the low price.

Bought this on a whim because I had a little credit in my Steam Wallet, and didn't fancy trawling through my list of games to find something I fancied playing.

It's a really, really simple game. The gameplay mechanics are simple; The scoring mechanism is simple; The controls are simple; It's just... simple, and it works. It's great fun! It's as stressful as you make it - if you want to chill out, just spend a little time soaring around a bit - it can be surprisingly relaxing, if you want it to be. If you want a little more action, step it up a bit... fly a bit closer, a bit faster, a bit riskier. Push your skills to the limit, scrape those edges, pull up at the last minute! Crash! Start again! Over and over. Then relax for a bit, soar around a bit. Then go again! Swoop around! Soar! Bored? Find a portal to a different map. Do it all again!

Great, simple fun for not much money. What's not to like?!

36518745.review:
Anybody remember AaAaAAA, the minimalist neo-futuristic base jumping game with a surreal sense of humor? This is like that, except with a wingsuit and procedural generation. And without the PSA on what to do if you accidentally travel back in time.

It's cheap, and equally straightforward: glide around levels and drift close to terrain to score [strike]kisses[/strike] points. Don't smash into anything. You can also type in whatever character strings you like to generate landscapes, like for instance "dogbo[b][/b]llocks". Try that one, actually, it's pretty fun. You can also save the ones you like for sharing or easy access.

The one real flaw in this system is that you have to save a level while you're still on it -- if you take a portal to another level or fall out of the bottom, that level is lost in rotation. They need to add a buffer for saving levels. There's also on occasion a level that will spawn you directly in front of a wall that you can't possibly avoid. Not fun to run into on a high score run. That said, it's cheap and fun enough to still recommend.

THE GOOD:
the game is really entertaining. you basically create your own experience, you either play chilled and relaxed, smoothly gliding through bizarre landscapes or if you are more competitive and slightly suicidal you divebomb blindly into caverns and tunnels that promise quite the adrenaline rush. 

THE BAD:
sadly this is often the end of a run as 90% of the time these caverns either have no exit at all or require you to steer through a pin needle sized window at a 180 degree arc without any chance to move the camera. also you can only steer with one stick, spinning around the longitudinal axis with the second stick would make flying way better controlable. also you can`t perform loopings or any other shap maneuver to stop a collision. so you start to play it safe as risk is not really rewarded if you want to climb up in the leaderboards. this usually means that you find yourself circling on the outside of these rock formations as going "in land" often prooves futile (especially in levels with the skyscrapper-sized rock needles).

still, the graphis are wonderfully alien and the feeling of "flying" is great. in times of shitty lootbox AAA titles this is more than worth the 3 bucks!

36513824.review:
A wonderfully intuitive (that word gets thrown around a lot in the description and comments for this game, but it is well deserved) and exciting game. I'm notorious for getting bored easily but they've done a splendid job with the procedural generation and physics engine meaning it is always different and I can enjoy wooshing through brand new maps at break-neck speed.

It is a warmly recommended impulse buy which is worth much more than it is priced for. You should get it no matter what!

---

I'd like to offer players some tips I'd like to think help enhance your gameplay experience even further:

- Play with a controller. 
When I switched to a controller I was able to make more fine adjustments which of course helps tremendously with getting points (and with frustration).

- Turn off audio for scoring points.
The experience gets a lot more "zen" without the sound of racking up points all the time. Unless you play on actual Zen mode where there are no points, but I still recommend turning off the score sound.

- Play some appropriate music in the background.
Feeding off my point above, when there are no distracting sounds apart from the wind and effects then you should improve your experience by playing some great music in the background. Think the soundtrack from the scene in Avatar when Jake flies for the first time. I recommend the YouTube video "3-Hours Epic Music Mix | MOST BEAUTIFUL MUSIC - Best Of Collection -" by Pandora Journey which I feel fits perfectly with this game.

- Play it safe!
It might not be as fun, but it is helpful to know that you can get a lot of points just flying close-ish to walls and staying there as your multiplier goes up. Key is actually knowing when to -not- take risks. Thread those holes if you feel sure you can, if you're at the right angle and speed etc, not just because there is a narrow opening that can give you a lot of points.

Another helpful tip: Unless you know the map, DON'T try to fly into caves and holes that you can't see a bright white light through. If the light is dim there is a risk you'll find yourself in a dead end and lose your run! I learned this the hard way, repeatedly.

36509295.review:
In summary: I enjoy it, my teenage daughter enjoys it, my neighbour enjoys it and even my PS4 FPS addicted friend enjoys it. If you buy it, you will enjoy it too! 

Simple controls that feel realistic. Nose up, you climb, lose airspeed, slow down, controls get mushy and you inevitably stall. Nose down and you gain airspeed, controls become zippy and you can pull off awesome tiny adjustments and maneuvres.

Graphics are beautiful. Multicoloured fractal fantasy landscapes that change as often as you want. I found myself diving or heading for a portal if I didn't like the particular world or became bored swooping around one landscape. You can save maps (seeds) you like, share them with friends or randomly create your own.

Sound is pleasant and works for the game, just the wind and (optionally) the sound of your points racking up. Try turning off the sound and choosing your own soundtrack for the game.

On my machine it was a 130 mb download (I didn't know games still came that small!), installed smoothly and I was playing in a few minutes. Best $2,70 ever spent, best game played this year.

36507703.review:
[h1]Cool your jets hotshot, because Superflight gets it Super-right[/h1]

I picked up this gem in a sale. From start to finish, it was an absolute pleasure to play.
It’s a simple, straight forward game, in which you have to glide through a randomly generated world, like a rip roaring, mad-rad, son-of-a-bitch.

[h1]No engines, no waypoints, no guns.[/h1]

You’ll need to rack up a good score by flying as close to the scenery as possible, and keeping a combo by not straying too far from the terrain. Swooping through the pre-made archways will usually net you a bonus score, too.

As long as your PC is up to the task of running it, the one thing you’ll need for this game, is a controller. My first couple of flights with the keyboard, proved this to me. On the controller, you’ll only need to touch the analogue stick and the reset button. That’s it.

The sound effects are great, too. Wind feels like it’s rushing past your face, and it’s hard not to be taken in by it. Superflight is a game that i will always admire, and would hopefully get some more content in the future. Maybe along the lines of a downhill run, with markers to hit.

And for the achievement hunters, it’s easy achievements.

[h1]Buy Superflight, grow a beard, and become more awesome.[/h1]

36505345.review:
Initial thoughts:

This is a fun little "feeling of flight" game that uses its limited mechanics well and has some fun procgen touches that are actually really effective.

It's definitely worth the price of entry if the preview videos look fun or interesting to you.

Some points of note/interest:
[list]
[*]The physics system doesn't seem totally accurate, but rather has gamified touches that might be abusable if that's something that interests you in a game.
[*]Scoring system feels like it might be 'breakable' by just following the outside edges of the map rather than doing the fun part of diving through the tight bits.
[*]Generating seeds out of words got me some fun maps.
[/list]

This is definitely a game that would benefit disproportionately from an additional 'polish' patch to touch up the sound, UI, and fidelity of the visuals. That's purely wish fulfilment though; it's a perfectly fun game in its current state, especially at its price point.

36501819.review:
Superflight is a game where you're flying a blocky dude in a wingsuit. It's beautiful, fun, chill and exhilarating all at the same time.
The controls are simple to grasp, but you will find yourself splattered against a wall many, many times before you start to master it.

I have so far played it just to relax inbetween other stuff. I've been playing it instead of other stuff. I've been playing it while drinking beers with friends, trying to outdo eachother at combos and daredevil routes, and I've been playing to conquer that elusive first place on the highscore.
The feeling you get when you're diving through small crevices is enormously satisfying and I simply cannot put the game down.
The devs seems like nice guys, and they're actively trying to keep the leaderboard free from bug-abusers and the like, which is great.

Buy this game, you will not regret it!

[h1]Una sensación de velocidad que no han conseguido ni los AAA![/h1]
Superflight es un juego super facil de explicar:
Básicamente descendemos con un Wingsuit a traves de diferentes formaciones rocosas creadas de forma procedural y tenemos que intentar hacer la máxima puntuacion posible volando de forma peligrosa. 
Esto significa rozando paredes, casi saboreandolas y pasando a traves de agujeros y cuevas para obtener más puntos y combos mas largos.
Soy MUY FAN de este juego desde el primer segundo.

[h1]PROS[/h1]
-Adictivo, simple, casual, dificil, rejugable a tope... 
-Graficos simples pero bonitos y paleta de colores preciosa y con infinidad de niveles que podemos guardar facilmente para rejugarlos.
-Posibilidad de introducir nosotros una "seed" para crear los niveles.
-Sensacion de velocidad IM PRE SIO NAN TE. Muy muy bien lograda, en serio.
-Precio Increible que convierte el juego en un "no brainer".
-Super Estable. No he tenido problemas de ningun tipo con el juego y pesa poquisimo.
-Controles super sencillos (arriba, abajo, derecha e izquierda) compatible 100% con mando y con teclado.
-Efectos de sonido muy guapos. El sonido del viento es acojonante.

[h1]CONS (Mas que cosas negativas, cosas que pondría)[/h1]
-Me gustaria un modo Primera Persona.
-Me gustaria que los mapas fueran verticalmente mas largos.

36492004.review:
I really like this game.  I knew I liked it from the moment I tried it, but I figured it would be one of those little "hey this is neat" things that kept my interest for an hour and then it would never be played again.  Now that I'm four hours into playing it, on and off, here and there, I think I'm going to definitely get a lot more than my $3 worth out of this one.

It doesn't have a story, it doesn't have skins, it doesn't have a plot.  There is nothing pushing you, and no goals outside of your score and some achievements, possibly.  What it does have is simplicity, and immediacy.  It downloads quickly, installs quickly, and starts quickly.  If you die, tap the space bar and you're playing again instantly.  This is low grade, mellow fun that's always ready to go the moment you want it, with no delays.

I'm prone to trying to fly through every window, so my highest score at this point is barely over 50,000, but it's not the score that keeps me playing, it's just that it's so pleasantly soothing to play.  This game really does make a great palate cleanser when you've just ragequit rocket league or lost three matches in a row in TES:L or something.

Playing it can be a very zen experience for me.  I throw on some music and just fly.

I rate this "would splatter my brains over rainbow colored procedural cliffs again" out of 10.

36487674.review:
The very best part about this game is that it's only as hard as you choose to make it. Every level could easily be bypassed if you didn't like it. There's always another one. And every so often you'll come across one so good you'll be glad to save it into your saved maps list.

Perfect in its simplicity, this is what I always wanted Dejobaan Games' "AAAAAAAAAAAAH! For The Awesome" series to be, but without the development hell.

This game delivers on the premise in a wonderful way: You're falling. You're in a wingsuit. You score points by flying close to walls, shooting through gaps, chasms, and loops, etc. One touch of anything means death and restarting (a very painless process; one button press and you're right back into it, or linger to watch your flight path replay in reverse). 

Controls are best by analogue stick for this. 

Cons: There's some quality of life options I'd like, like the option to change the sound of the scoring. I ended up just turning that sound right off. I also find it a little aggravating that there's no centered reticle on the screen to show exactly where you're aiming (although momentum plays a role in your path, so perhaps that would just serve to confuse?). The graphics are simple and I could do with more variety, but I'm sure that can come in time.

Pros: It's simple and perfect. Go fly your wingsuit through procedural worlds. Most runs only take 1-3 minutes.

36472615.review:
SUMMARY: MUST-BUY.   A simple-to play, fun, and precise game of using your wingsuit to fly through procedural worlds.  Rack up points for stunts, dive through portals, generate and save maps.  For a few dollars you'll get hours of entertainment, relaxation, and chil challenge .

Superflight is an easy game to describe - you fly through procedural worlds in a wingsuit, trying to rack up points by doing stunts.

What that description isses is just how well this simple, focused game does that:
1) Controls are simple WASD, very intuitive.  It doesn't take long for you to master them - or at least not be awful.
2) The procedural worlds are colorful "sky formations" - usually mountains, but at times spires, islands, platforms, and more.  There's enough variable generation to surprise you as you fly about.
3) A simple scoring mechanism lets you challenge yourself - mostly the closer you fly to something the longer more points (even more in tunnels)
4) Random generation and saveable maps let you save wondrous places with your friends.
5) You can play in a short burst or loose yourself for an hour.

Superflight is pretty much a must-buy if you want a relaxing casual actioner.  You can't go wrong with the price to get something so well-made.  Best of all ints incredibly accessible - almost anyone could enjoy this.

Also?  Great gift.  Where else can you give someone hours of enjoyment for a few dollars?

36455622.review:
This is the best purchase I have made in a long time this year. 

[b][i]Superflight[/i][/b] is a casual game with really great gameplay. It's simple, yet addictive. Within 2 minutes of gameplay, I was hooked. This is meant to be a casual game, again, so eventually, I'll be playing this game in short bursts, but that is the point. It's an escape from other power-hungry, AAA-titled games that demand a lot of energy from you. The art style is great, it reminds me of the style used in Sumotori Dreams. Simple, but very fitting, since I consider this an "art" game. 

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]

[*][b][u]The gameplay:[/u][/b] It's simple. You fly around the landscape and get points by flying close to the walls as possible. But, this will prove addictive. You'll say "Huh, that's it? Pretty easy." Well, you'll get to the point where you'll keep restarting, but this time you're not raging. It's not a game you could rage to, and that's the beauty of it. It's such a relaxing game, but it still gets you straight up on the chair, as you tighten your butt trying to go through so many crevices. It is engaging, it is relaxing, it is plain fun. You can also create your own maps (though, I think the system simply conjures one up for you), and save maps you think you had a jolly good time in.  

[*][b][u]The visuals:[/u][/b] I like how abstract enough the game is made to look to give off the laid-back feel to it. It's easy on the eyes, nothing flashy, it's very simple, but the particle system, ambience, the colour palette used to fit the theme of the game worked so well with the idea of the game, you'll eventually want to occasionally fly around just to admire the landscapes.

[*][b][u]The controls:[/u][/b] The controls are extremely simple. You use WASD to manoeuvre in the air. Controller support is excellent, I had no issues with it. I played a lot better with the controller, since using the keys will pitch the character to 100%, while pushing the left stick on my PS4 controller according to just how much I really want to makes it easier for me to direct my character in an efficient manner. What I noticed though, is that pressing the confirm button with the controller when highlighting the "Quit" option brings you back into the game. It could be a glitch. Hopefully, this gets addressed soon. Not a problem for me, though, it's very minor.
[/list]   

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]

[*][b][u]The soundtrack:[/u][/b] It's not that what you hear in the game that is bad... it's the lack of it. When I read "This game doesn’t have:", I went through the list to see "A Soundtrack" as one of the listed items. I was somewhat disappointed. For a game like this, a slow soundtrack would work so beautifully. I mean, it doesn't [b]have[/b] to have it, but I like to imagine something upbeat and artsy playing as you soar through the skies.

This point is not necessarily a con either, given how the game's ambience is meant to calm you more than give you a brilliant auditory and visual experience. But still... it would be really nice to have it. I guess I'll just Shift+Tab and use YouTube in the background...
[/list]

[h1]My Personal Suggestions:[/h1]
[list]

[*][b][u]First Person Switchability:[/u][/b] Now hear me out. Imagine flying around in first person. Not a lot of us have the luxury to go wingsuit flying. And since the game is powered by Unity, adding an FPS camera is easy! If not, then I hope this game has community content for mods, and a modder would make it possible.

[*][b][u]One More Mode?:[/u][/b] So far, there's only Zen Mode. Good thing, too, looking at the score can be annoying, since it'll keep you engaged all the time. But, what if we add a mode with loops to pass through as you fly around? That would add a tiny bit of a challenge.

[*][b][u]Mouse Control:[/u][/b] Now this is possibly a lot harder to implement, but I feel I could play the game with a LOT more control if I was using my mouse to fly, instead of a keyboard. It'll be like flight stick or something. 

[*][b][u]Steam Trading Cards:[/u][/b] . . . Please? :3 

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]

Indie Game of the Year 2017. I'm calling it. 

I've always wanted a game like this. And finally, that prayer has been answered. There's no game like this. And the best part is that this was made with just three dudes. I salute you guys. I can imagine just how much work would've gone into something as small as this. It's not easy. And the price tag, wow, really cheap. Maybe it should never be on sale, the asking price itself is the biggest discount ever! The game is unique. And that's more than enough of a word for someone to convince themselves to buy this game. 

And the proudest moment they must share is that this is their first game. What other indie game company has produced a game with such mastery? Just a handful. The numbers are definitely growing. But, it's still a handful. What [b][i]Superflight[/i][/b] achieves is that it literally stands out as this curious, serene little experience. It's a breath of fresh air. 

[i]GrizzlyGames[/i] could just very well be an indie [i]CD Projekt[/i].

great game! well worth the 3 EUR or whatever it is.

the gfx are real simple but sharp and very charismatic. the sound / wind noise really adds to the sense of speed. i turned off the scoring sound effects though which have become a bit annoying after a while. the maps are generally quite good, i haven't come across a map design yet that i flat out didn't like. the controls (ps3 controller here) are super simple and spot on.

i think it would be cool to have some advanced movement options such as pitch/roll to make tighter turns for example. i think this would greatly add to the skill ceiling. also, how about a multiplayer version where you can fly across the maps together with other players? not sure how/if that would work because of the randomly generated maps though. maybe that's something to look into for a future update or maybe even superflight 2.

anyway, gotta go back to chasing highscores.

36451166.review:
Simple yet entertaining; elegant yet not obstructive,

Superflight is a minimalistic explortation game where you control a wingsuit roaming through various landscapes of rocks, ravines and holes in a randomly generated world.

Performance is (for those wandering), as to be expected for indie games, not as good as it could be, but not awfully so. I certainly wasn't obstructed.

There is a leaderboard system if you feel so inclined, though I suspect the top spots have been achieved through macros or other cheats.

It's worth the £1.88 I paid for it.

36450917.review:
[list]
[*][b]Genre tags:[/b] Flight, Wingsuit, Casual, Score-Attack, Zen
[*][b]Value Proposition:[/b] For $3 it's a steal. Great palette cleanser.  
[*][b]BSERC[/b] - (Borderline Sardonic and Extremely Reductive Comparison): More casual version of Volo Airsport 
[/list]
[h1]Concomitant Exposition and Summation[/h1]

[b]SuperFlight[/b] is a wingsuit game with simple controls and procedurally generated maps that will give you as much back as you put into it. 

The goal of the game is too simply fly or [i]fall[/i] around the generated maps and get as close to crashing as your heart desires to increase your score. There are great screen effects from camera shakes and sound design with the wind rushing past your ears. The closer you get the more intense it becomes.

There is specifically a “Zen-mode” which in essence turns off the score function so as to [i]lose yourself[/i] I suppose to become [i]one[/i] with falling. 

If you're insane like me, or maybe just playing while a bit sleep deprived you may find yourself ascribing different chemical elements or story to some of the worlds generated. They all have different shapes, some with dramatic horizontal planes, some with blocky mountain like stature carved with tunnels, others with glorious pikes and columns. All of which have an associated color scheme to be mixed and matched. Some devoid of any color saturation at all. You might start thinking you're just falling through wormholes and visiting random worlds. Some zapped of resources, a once thriving and fortuitous world down on their luck of serendipitous endeavors. Others, a dangerous world filled with magna boiling under the surface or others infiltrated by evil forces covering the land in darkness. 

Or, you'll just enjoy flying around until you smash your face into a wall for getting too daring or something distracts you. 

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/25764029/][i]Follow my curation page for more.[/i][/url]

36449543.review:
I never thought I’d be any good at wingsuit flying. First, it would require me to climb a mountain, or jump out of a plane, two things that I don’t plan on doing anytime soon, if at all. Second, I’m certain that as soon as I take flight, my body would involuntarily seize up, and I would just Frisbee into the side of the mountain, spewing vomit the whole way. Third, it would require me to go outside for an extended period of time, and hahahahaha.

So instead, my pale, but perfectly-safe, butt gets to experience wingsuit flying via video entertainment. Namely, through Superflight, a new indie game from GrizzlyGames.

The premise is simple: players take control of a little figure who appears to be made out of cardboard. It’s exactly as I imagine I’d look if someone gave me a moving box and said, “Here Tom, now go fly.” This is about how I’d end up looking:

And then I would die.

My time playing Superflight was half spent saying, “Ooooh, neat!” at the colorful landscapes I flew through, and half spent saying, “Ooooh, shit!” at the colorful landscapes I flew into.

It’s okay though, dying in Superflight is no big deal; players who crash lose whatever point combo-chain they had and their remaining point score is tallied on a personal and global ranking. Points are easily acquired by flying close to the landscapes, or through the little caverns and holes that are usually scattered throughout every zone. Each zone takes the form of a floating landmass, and the player is dropped near the top. If the player flies below the floating landmass, they’re transported to another zone where the descent continues. There are even warp portals that players can fly through to instantly be transferred to a new zone and pick up some bonus points for doing so.

Zones are procedurally-generated and players can generate and save their own maps to share with friends. For example, if you type EpicBrew into the seed generator, you’ll get a blindingly pink map. Pro tip: there is a hole straight down from the start of the map that leads right through to the bottom, so you can escape before your retinas burn out.

For under $3, I did not expect Superflight to bring much to the table. What you see in the video is what you get. The sound design is a bit rough around the edges, —quieting the wind whistling noise was a necessity— and a nice ambient soundtrack would have been nice, but then again, Superflight is a $3 game. Adding a custom soundtrack or a sound designer would bump that price up by a handful of dollars. An excessive cost when Spotify fixes the problem just fine.

I found that playing Superflight with a controller (I used a USB Xbox 360 controller and it worked flawlessly) feels so much better than using the keyboard. For whatever reason, the mouse is not used, so flying is controlled with the WASD keys, which felt clunky. The joystick on the controller felt so much smoother, and I could even recline back in my chair as I flew my little cardboard Iron Man into another mountainside.


[[RECOMMENDED]] Superflight is a fun, affordable game that perfectly fits into a quiet evening.


This review originally appeared on epicbrew.net.
A Steam copy of this game was purchased by Epic Brew for the purpose of this review.

36449226.review:
Superflight is a good casual game and I imagine it would be a lot of fun playing it with friends on a big TV. The variety of random maps and the sense of speed you get when flying through them is exciting.

It can be played as agressively or as carefully as you prefer. Relaxed gliding around the edge of the maps will almost certainly allow you to continue onto the next map, whereas daredevil flying through narrow twisty canyons eventually leads to a sudden and messy end.

There are a few problems with it at time of writing. Sometimes the invisible out of bounds areas are too close to the edge of the random map, forcing you into a cliff face without warning. Occasionally the start points have you fly straight in to near unavoidable obstacles. These are seldom a problem once you get the hang of the game and I hope are tackled by the developers (out of bounds could definitely do with being bigger).

All in all a fun little casual concept game. Great for times when you don't want to play anything in particular, but know you want to play something to pass the time.

36445381.review:
SuperFlight is an indie game made by three students on Unity. This game was [b]originally[/b] made as a school project but the developers seemed to love this game so much that they put it on steam for a cheap price, and I am so glad they did. Do / Did you enjoy the Just Cause 3 Wingsuit experience? If you did, SuperFlight is for you.

SuperFlight is a Wing-suit simulator where you are supposed to get the highest score possible to have a ranking of #1. Unfortunately, It isn't all that easy. To gain points, you must do dangerous stunts for a long time (i.e Flying really close to a ceiling, ground or walls). This can be very difficult to some as you have to survive at least 1 second after the stunt for the score to save. If you crash, you lose all the points you had then and you die. It's that simple.

The gameplay is smooth and it's completely worth playing. There are multiple randomly generated maps to play. You can even put in a random seed and it will give you a new never-seen-before map. Each map contains multiple portals too so you do not have to stick to one map until you die. When you go through a portal, a brand new map spawns and you get +1000 points added to your score. The more portals you go through, the higher your score goes. There is also a lot of competition in this game, ranking wise. This means that it will take a lot of effort to get Ranking #1. So far, my high score is 11,000 in a gameplay space of 5 minutes and the ranking for that is #1800. 

It is def. worth replaying too. The game offers hours of content as you can play over 1,000 randomly generated map so you do not have to stick with one map. The replayability feature makes this game really fun. 

It is also amazingly optimised for a game made by students. I can run this game at 180fps on 1080p, AMD R7, Intel i3-6100. I did have to turn down the Anti-aliasing to AAx2 but it is still great. I'm sure it is even optimised enough for Toshiba, Lenovo Laptops! 

Overall, It is worth the buy, especially as the price is extremely low. It is worth grabbing completely! Hopefully they may be able to make multiplayer one day! Good luck GrizzlyGames!

10/10 - SepticSlither

36444530.review:
Wonderful little game - hints of race the sun but more vertical.

Some obvious scope for future development if the devs decide to stick around - such as daily runs etc. But I think it's a very pure distilled game so no need for too much gubbins - it's better for its simplicity, and it's clear they're not the kind of devs that will waste time on appeasing the co-op crafting battle royal crowd that muscle their way into every experience these days.

If I could change one thing it would be the point scoring audio - you can turn it down/off but I like the audio feedback, but the effects chosen are kind of grating (cash register noise) - something more soothing would go a long way there.

But it's great, buy it, no question.

36430087.review:
Excelent jeu indépendant !! Tombé dessus par hasard et pas du tout décu ! 

J'aime les jeux parfois sans prise de tête qui nous déconnecte et qui nous rendent accro ! Refunct m'avait fait le même effet par exemple ! 

On incarne un personnage mystérieux dont on ne sait rien et dans un univers étrange très surréaliste avec des couleur pouvant faire penser à un rêve.. Le but ? VOLER !  le rêve de beaucoup d'entre nous ! et ici la sensation est excelente ! 

On évolue dans de multiples map générée procéduralement avec meme la possibilité de crée son "seed" Elles sont très différente et parfois même surprenante ! 

Ici ce ne sera pas du speedrun comme pour un refunct mais plutot un jeu sur base de score a battre ! Les points montent en fonction de vos actions (froler une falaise, passer dans un trous de souris etc..) 

Pour finir je le compare encore à Refunct mais je voulais dire qu'il posséde également cette touche zen et relaxante..une interface éfficace rapide a prendre en main..on réfléchi pas et on se laisse porter par le vent...

Pour 3euros ça en vaut la peine !! JE CONSEIL FORTEMENT DE JOUER AVEC DE LA MUSIQUE ! (Il n'y à pas de musique in game il me semble..) mettez vos sons un  peu chill et planer !

This game does exactly what it states:

It loads fast, you fly fast and it conveys the sense of speed really well once you get a feel for its movement.

I picked it up as an impulse buy on lunch today and I'm a fan.

Would love to see a few extra manuevering controls added, as well as a non-leaderbord mode that let you adjust the character's flight/physics parameters as well as have a button to give thrust/momentum for endless flight.

Other than gameplay options, the ability to re-name saved maps would be nice- as it stands saved pre-gens are just tagged with seed values and a generic icon. It doesnt detract at all, just a QoL request.

--------------

Games a steal at its price if you enjoy its style, I recommed using Zen mode- its a blast with speakers cranked up.

36426094.review:
You are controling a guy in a wingsuit inSuperflight. As you fly, you try to avoid the object but at the same time, take some risk to get extra points. Simply no risk, no gain issue.

 After first few rounds I played, I was really afraid of the controls but as I continued playing, I got used to them pretty fast. The point is you have to keep your balance with your aim as gravity pulls you down. If you aim higher for a second, next second you will be having a sharp dive which can result a controll loss and make you crash somewhere. You have to keep the balance all the time and never forget that gravity always wants to pull you down so you can not draw straight parallel flying route for yourself.

This game is simple,  unique and really fun. I am pretty sure I won't stop playing it time to time till I get all the achievements completed. Also I have to mention Devs are really responsive and working hard on their job. While there are lots of garbage and achievement spammer games around nowadays, from my point of view this game is shining amongst them. Good job guys, keep up the good work and give us more!

36423469.review:
Well, that game does exactly what it promises and is well worth its price.

The presentation video will show you these promises.

I found three problems with Superlight: the graphics are not that beautiful and the camera is sometimes clumsy (especially when your going straightly downward) and -that's the most important- as the levels are procedurally generated, you can't know that the hole in which you are going is a dead-endor not, resulting sometimes in unfair (because of unpredictable) deaths (I call that places "traps"). I could add that in the darker maps, you're not always sure that you're going to a hole or a shadow. But that's all, ant that's not that important.

That's typically the kind of small game you play for a few minutes every now and there.

The controles are indeed simple: w and s to go up and down, a and d to go left and right. The more you press the button, the more you'll go to that direction. The real challenge here is to master them enough to do exactly what you want (that is: going through that tiny hole).
The sensation of speed is really well done, and the maps quickly look like a series of challenges.

As you may imagine, the game is repetitve, but it's made for short sessions.

7/10: immediatly fun, well worth its price.

[spoiler] It's a game about life: you'll always go to the bottom, but only to rise again to the top. [/spoiler]

36412021.review:
Superflight is nothing groundbreaking but it tells you exactly what it sets out to do and does it extremely well. Don't let the minimal look turn you off as it is several marks above some of the less than quality games that sometimes come out on Steam.

The physics aren't as simple as "point to fly there" as your wingsuit genuinely feels like a wingsuit. Altitude is hard to regain without a severe speed penalty and you constantly feel the weight of your blocky flier. This puts a theoretical cap on your scoring ability and offers a more serious side if you're interested in score chasing.

The sounds are well done if a bit simple. You hear a nice ticking sound as you build up score and a nice deposit sound once your combo ends. The wind rushes past you and adds to that sense of speed.

The game runs on my potato rig that lacks a dedicated gpu. It's less than 3 dollars and still refundable after a dozen runs. The trailer on this store page tells you exactly what this game is. What's keeping you from trying it out? If you can spare the cash, go try it!

36411034.review:
Love this game! Playing this after a really hard day at work and it's seriously so therapeutic. 

Very easy to pick up with no clutter between you and a thrilling high-speed flying experience. But don't get me wrong, the game takes time to master and once your skills develop and you nail that crazy close-call combo for the first time, the rush is indescribable. The controls just feel RIGHT. And when you do crash, you feel like it was your fault and you immediately want to jump back in to try again, and see if a different maneuver might work. It's definitely got that "just-one-more-time" feel to it. Super addictive.
 
The only thing that seemed really unnecessary to me at first was the sound effect for the points, but that's easy to turn off in the sound settings!

Super cheap, instant fun, and vast replayability with the procedurally generated levels system. Great job guys!

Superflight is a simple yet very addicting game. You can play it for a casual experience or you can go on a thrilling chase for a highscore.

The artstyle and sound effects really makes the game immersive, it's very relaxing and calming.

It's honestly great to see 3 indie developers creating something with a passion, surely the game is not the "Game of the year" and by no means does it hold against all these big games releasing from the left to the right. But the beauty of it all is the fact that it doesn't have to, it's not trying to be the best or the biggest game. Just a fun and simple casual experience you can play whenever you feel like.

Well done GrizzlyGames!

This is a fantastic game if you like this feeling of playing a level again and again to get the highest scoring combo or that perfect route through the small crevices of one of the endless stunning maps - but it is also great if you just want to relax and fly for a while. It looks beautiful without the need to be realistic, each map has a certain look and feel within the framework Superflight's aesthetics and the controls feel just right, especially since they can be customized to your liking.

Superflight also cuts away any unneeded additional systems that would just clutter it up. Instead the devs decided to really focus on this games central mechanic which is gliding through endless amounts of always different generated worlds.

For such a low pricepoint I can only recommend this to everyone to whom this sounds appealing. Enjoy!

36403748.review:
Update:  Auch Tage später ist Superflight noch die Überraschung des Jahres.

Ich bin bei dem Preis von unter 5€ eigentlich immer ein wenig skeptisch, was die Qualität des Spiels betrifft. Der Trailer mit dem angenehmen VoiceOver verspricht hingegen genau das, was ich im Moment gesucht habe: Ein angenehmes Indie-Spiel für Zwischendurch.

Wie sehr ich mich getäusch hatte, zeigte sich 90 Minuten später, als ich bemerkte dass ich das Spiel beim "Ich teste das mal kurz"-Probelauf die Zeit vergaß und schon ganz verrückt nach dem immer besseren Hichscore und der besseren Kombo war. Und tatsächlich: Der Drang nach den knappesten Manövern und das Erkunden der prozeduralen Maps zur Optimierung meiner Flugbahn... ach, ich schweife ab.

Long Sotry short: Ich bin Platz #2 der weltweiten Kombo-Rangliste. Kauft es. Kauft es, jetzt für den lächerlich kleinen Preis von weniger als 3€ und dankt mir später, wenn der Hypezug losrollt. Das Spiel hat inhaltlich genauso viel Luft nach oben, wie die Welten nach unten - und genau das ist, was mich gerade so begeistert: Aus Superflight wird der nächste Geheimtipp. Und für die paar Taler? Geschenkt.

39362519.review:
[h1]Познай Дзен[/h1]

Игра, в которую можно играть бесконечно (но по чуть-чуть)

Superflight - атмосферная игра про свободный полет. Мы играем за человека (вроде как за человека, может и за птицу), который летит мимо скал. За опасное приближение к скалам игрок получает очки, чем опасней полет - тем больше очков. Таким образом. залетев в дырочку размером с главного героя, вы получите более 10к, спокойно. Если улететь в противоположную сторону, или вниз, игрок попадет на новую локацию. Также по локации разбросаны порталы, залетев в который игрок моментально окажется в другой локации.

Данная игра примечательна тем, что она подходит и для людей, которым нужны острые ощущения, и для тех, кто просто желает расслабиться. 

Хорошая картинка, спокойный саунд, легкие достижения и отличная атмосфера - вот как можно описать данную игру.

Крайне рекомендуется.

39277554.review:
I rarely write reviews but this is truly a gem of a game!  The free flight experience here is genuinely thrilling and beautifully packaged.  The flight physics model feels very realistic. The controls are only WASD/arrow keys but I found them very responsive.  Some might prefer a controller option, but it's really not needed.  I like that how challenging the game is is entirely up to you - fly safely and score slowly or be more daring and score quickly (but risk seeing yourself disintegrate!).

The ability to save maps and seed new ones (which you can share with friends) makes the game infinitely replayable.

This is a great game, whether just for casual play or chasing positions on the leaderboard and I don't recall having as much fun in a game, right from the off, in a very long time.  In fact, IMHO the fun to price ratio is stunningly high.

If you like speed, risk or flying this game won't disappoint and is a steal for less than the pricee of a coffee - an absolute msut buy!

39216056.review:
[b]Um jogo de wingsuit em que você vai se cansar de tanto morrer, mas sempre vai jogar "só mais uma". Tente conseguir a maior pontuação possível e faça manobras radicais. [/b]

[h1]Relaxante? Bem, nem sempre[/h1]
A proposta do jogo é simples, é direto ao ponto: voe com sua wingsuit e seja livre. Mas o que a princípio parece ser um jogo relaxante em que você se sente solto em mar de possibilidades, pode acabar virando mais um "Super Meat Boy", em que você morre inúmeras vezes e fica refazendo alguma manobra ou percurso que você pensou até conseguir completá-lo. As possibilidades são infinitas e as formas de jogar ainda mais. Sim, é possível jogar de forma descontraída sem levar tudo muito a sério, mas o jogo fica muito mais cativante quando você entra na brincadeira e se desafia a ir cada vez mais longe.

[h1]O jogo em si[/h1]
Superflight não é complexo, possui gráficos legais, mas nem um pouco detalhados. O que, na minha opinião, acrescenta muito a dinâmica do jogo é o formato de mundos gerados com seeds. A cada vez que se entra em um portal, ou você segue em direção ao horizonte, você é transportado a um mapa completamente diferente, com cores diferentes, estruturas diferentes e formatos novos. Para mim este é o ponto forte do jogo, o motivo de manter o jogador entretido por mais do que 10 minutos dentro dele, gera a curiosidade do jogador sobre o que virá a seguir e o que posso fazer neste novo cenário. 
A jogabilidade também é bem fluida e os comandos bem intuitivos, o que pode causar um pouco de dificuldade no início, mas rapidamente você será capaz de dominar a movimentação e planejar suas manobras mirabolantes. 


[b]Na minha visão não há pontos negativos a se destacar no jogo, ele é simples mas se prende e cumpre muito bem a sua proposta. A duração irá variar de acordo com a vontade de cada um, mas para um jogo tão barato, não vejo como isto pode se tornar uma má compra para alguém. [/b]

Veredito:
Nota -
[h1]7,5[/h1]

이것은 자유롭게 하늘을 날아다닌다기 보다는 글라이더를 타고 하강하는 즐거움이 있는 게임이다. 상승이 불가능한 것은 아니지만, 상승할 때에는 완만한 곡선을 그리며 상승하며 그 직후 상승할 에너지를 잃어버리면 그 이상으로 아래로 수직하강해버린다. 그러니 천천히 하강하면서 장애물을 피하기위해 아래로 내려가는 속도를 조절하거나 턱을 넘기위해 약간 상승하는 편이 게임을 하기에 수월하다.

게임에 대해서는 위에서 언급한 글라이더처럼 비행하는 즐거움이 있으며 속도가 빨라지거나 수직하강 할 때, 장애물에 부딪힐 뻔할 때에는 스릴마저 존재한다. 거기에 비행하는 맵의 구역에서 벗어나거나(아래, 앞, 옆등 갈 수 없는 하늘을 제외한 어디든지) 포탈을 타고다니면서 쉽게 질리지않는 탐험을 즐길 수도 있다.

하지만 끝나지않는 컨텐츠인만큼 연속적으로 긴시간 동안 하기에는 힘들 것같고 간간히 플레이하면서 도전과제를 노려보는 힐링게임으로 추천한다.

One of the best gliding games I've played.  It's a simple game with not a whole lot to it, but the gliding mechanics are fun and the terrain generator does a really nice job creating a wide variety of environments that tempt you to try reckless stunts and feel awesome when you pull them off. 39135264.review:
Dieses Spiel ist genial! Es ist wunderbar minimalistisch und die Spieleidee ist super! Für nur 3 Euro ist es unglaublich was man hier geboten bekommt.. Man kann das game immer weiterspielen, denn die Welten werden generiert, daher gibt es quasi unendlich Welten/Level ähnlich wie bei Minecraft. (Welten Seeds sind ebenfalls eingeb/ausles-bar. Die Welten sind relativ abwechselungsreich und wirklich schön gestaltet, und es macht Spaß sie zu durchfliegen. Es läuft wunderbar flüssig und bugfrei auf meinem low end PC (1Gb Grafikkarte, 8gb ram, i5 2500k...) und das auf DREI 1080p Monitoren per Eyefinity. Dazu ist es auch nahezu perfekt für drei Monitore geeignet, legedlich das Menü/Einstellungen sind nicht vollständig lesbar/nutzbar. Es geht in dem Spiel darum so nah wie möglich an und durch Objekte/Die Welten durchzufliegen und dabei so viele Punkte wie möglich zu erreichen. Je näher man an Dingen vorbei fliegt, oder je enger die Objekte sind durch die man durchfliegt/umso knapper eine Kollision ist, desto mehr Punkte bekommt man. Das sorgt dann des öfteren auch für einen kleinen Kick^^ Natürlich kann man auch einfach so rumfliegen und dabei gut entspannen..(Bin mir aber nicht sicher ob man die Punkte-Sounds deaktivieren kann) Ich lege jedem Spieler ans Herz, dieses Spiel mit einem Controller/Gamepad zu spielen (Ich nutze dafür den Xbox One Controller), denn damit funktioniert es auf jeden Fall präziser als mit den Pfeiltasten. Ich kann aber keine Angaben dazu geben ob andere Gamepads, oder NVidia Surround bei diesem Spiel funktioniert (Ich schätze aber mal es sollte funktionieren) Ich finde es schön zu sehen, wie ein relativ kleines Entwickler-Team hier so ein schönes spiel abliefern kann.. Respekt! Falls euch diese Beschreibung nicht reicht, hier noch mal eine kurze Beschreibung von den Enwicklern selbst hochgeladen (offenbar): 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxbOF5LDfEY&t=81s

Ich habe noch nie eine so ehrliche Videospielbeschreibung/Trailer gesehen :`D

Ich hoffe, ich konnte dem ein oder anderen weiterhelfen,
MfG Joschaxda

39120454.review:
Superflight is a simple free-falling simulator in which you control a man falling between mountains and landscapes all to earn points and do stunts.

Pros:
-Simple and fun. You get quite a kick out of travelling through a tiny crevice at great speeds or just seeing how close to the wall of a mountain you can get without crashing.
-There is also Zen Mode (which you can activate in options) in which you do not accumulate points and just wonder through the maps to relax
-Simple robust shapes and vibrant colours add a great atmosphere to the game, making it aesthetically pleasing to look at
-Easy to get into and play, with simple controls and basic mechanics, but this is perfectly executed
-It has Steam Achievements. They aren't too hard to get, will take you about 3-5 hours to 100% the game

Cons:
-None.

Overall, this is one of the best and most relaxing games I have played for its rather small price tag. Definitely worth a look
9/10

39110875.review:
Auch wenn meine aufgezeichnete Spielzeit nicht sonderlich hoch ist, kann ich zu Superflight ein kleines Review schreiben. Denn auch hier zeigt sich wieder einmal, das ein simples Spielprinzip nicht unbedingt ein schlechtes Spiel bedeuten muß.

Was ist Superflight?

Superflight stellt sich als arcadelastiges Wingsuit Spiel dar. Ihr seht euren Konterfei in der Third-Person-Perspektive und steuert diesen zwischen anmutenden Felsenschluchten und Höhlen hindurch um Punkte zu generieren. Diese werden dann in eine Weltrangliste eingetragen. Der Flug wird erst dann beendet, wenn ihr an einer Wand zerschellt. Abstürzen könnt ihr nur dann, wenn ihr gerade durch eine Höhle fliegt und nicht mehr genügend Auftriebsschwung habt. Ausserhalb der Felsengebilde gibt es keinen Boden. Erreicht ihr die Nebelbank unterhalb der Felsenformation, spawnt ihr automatisch in einem neu generierten Level und setzt euren Flug fort. Zwischen den Felsen verbergen sich hier und da auch lilafarbene Portale. Fliegt man in diese hinein,dann startet man direkt in einer neuen Welt.
Falls euch mal langweilig ist,dann kann man auch per Tastatureingabe krytische Buchstaben und Zahlenkombis eingeben um sich daraus selbst Level generieren zu lassen. Diese können dann auch, wenn sie euch besonders gut gefallen, abgespeichert und wiedergespielt werden.Für Abwechslung ist also gesorgt.
Die Grafik ist Zweckdienlich, aber auch nicht unbedingt hässlich. Einzig und allein hätte die Spielfigur ein paar mehr Polygone vertragen können.
Die Steuerung geht mit einem XBox360 Gamepad locker fluffig von der Hand.
Alles in allem kann man hier wirklich nicht meckern. Das Spiel macht wirklich eine Menge Spaß und lädt immer wieder für ein Spiel zwischendurch ein.
Klare Kaufempfehlung von meiner Seite her.

39073882.review:
[i]Note and TLDR: I bought the game around the Winter Sale of 2017 with a very decent price. Sale or not, I recommend purchasing it whenever you have an extra amount of cash remaining. I am not a fan of the whole "block" and procedurallly generated maps but Superflight is a game worth buying if even if not you're into atmospheric gliders full of repetition and fluidity. [b]Superflight does it different.[/b] The game is complimented by realistic wind and very easy controls and beautiful maps that will leave you wanting to more.[/i]With that, let's proceed with the Review.

[list]
 [*]Superflight is a simple indie atmospheric game where you, the player, glides through procedurally generated maps or levels. You earn points gliding through holes, gliding at a daring space between the floor, walls or ceilings. You only "die" if you smack yourself to something. 

 [*]Superflight has easy controls but the game itself is difficult at first. But as you slowly get into the game, you find yourself playing dozens of minutes before you realize you were actually playing within an hour already. 

 [*]The game also realistic wind complimenting the difficulty even more.

[*]The game is beautiful, really. Considering the fact that these are procedurally generated maps, every has a different kind of charm while still having the same aesthetic.

[*]Speaking of maps, you can save maps you accidentally discovered and loved. 

[*]Portals in the game transport you to a different map. Simple feature but fun otherwise.

 [*]Feeling competitive? Well, the game also offers a scoreboard so you, the player, can figure out where you are standing globally.

 [*]That's about it. 
[/list]

[i]Verdict with (more) Additional Notes: I admit that the game has more potential than many would realize. Heading onto the Suggestions/Discussion Thread, you can really see that the game can grow and develop more as a whole. But, considering the fact that the game is made by a small team and it was fairly recently made, they already made a game worth buying and playing. I would love to see what the small teams of devs can cook up into the future of Superflight. In this, I have hope considering the fact that the small community that makes of the game is active than you simply think. I absolutely see myself investing in the game since the potential of Superflight can only be seen if you play it. If you are not into these type of games, feel free to buy it during sale. With its decent price, the satisfaction of playing is worth more than the actual price. Superflight is worth giving a shot nevertheless.[/i]
