39065782.review:
[h1]Rating[/h1]
[b]6/10[/b]

[h1]Worth it?[/h1]
I definitely don't regret buying it, but it's a very specific game. 
Only get if you're into this kind of thing (or want to try something new).

[h1]Playtime[/h1]
It took me less than 2 hours to get 100% of achievements.

[h1]Comparison[/h1]
[b]Race The Sun[/b], [b]Fugl[/b] or [b]AaAaAA!!! - A Reckless Disregard for Gravity[/b].

[h1]Plot[/h1]
There isn't any.
There's no goal, no endgame, it's just flying. For fun.

[h1]Look...[/h1]
The maps are pretty and they serve the main purpose of the game - relaxation - very well.
With procedural generation, they look different each time, even though they are built with the same components.

[h1]... and Feel[/h1]
It's awesome! I've never had a chance to fly a real wingsuit, but this is exactly how I hope it would feel like.
I've mostly played with a controller and it was great. I checked out keyboard too and it was good enough. Controller feels more natural, but if you prefer a keyboard, you'll be fine too.

[h1]Music[/h1]
There's no music here, just the whooshing sound of air when you're flying. And the occasional crash noise.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
There are two game modes. 
First one is competitive - you get points for flying close to structures. The closer you fly by, the more points you get. And you have to beat your high score.
The second one is called Zen - all the HUD notifications are disabled. You don't have to worry about points, multipliers or anything else. You just fly, enjoy the view and try to relax.

One feature worth mentioning here is the procedural generation. Yes, I've said it before, it's there. But the cool thing about it is that each map is generated based on a seed number. That means when you encounter a map that you like, you can save its seed and regenerate the same map whenever you want. Or you can share that seed with your friends or anyone else, so they can try to beat your score on the exact same map. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
I've played this game for two hours and that was time well spent. 
But I don't think I'm gonna be playing it much more than that.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
- relaxing
- pretty, procedurally generated maps
- seed numbers, allowing to exchange maps with friends

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- no endgame
- nothing to do after 2 hours



[i]For more reviews, follow my Curator page[/i] - [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31210849-Sublime-Dent/]Sublime Dent[/url][/b].

Since it is not a linear game, you can go wherever you want in the map, so if you are stuck, just go somewhere else in the map.

39041467.review:
This is an awesome little challenge game but I have to say there's no way I can see it being a nice relaxing, head clearing meditation with the insane amount of speed and the fact that you crash so darn frequently even if you simply circle the outside of the maps. I have no problem with this being a stressfull game, it's actually super fun that way, but the video claims it can be relaxing so I just wanted to mention that at least in my opinion this is far from the case. Maybe if they added in a slow down button it could be more so. 

Haven't played the game for very long as of yet but it is incredibly fun and definitely worth the asking price. The random worlds are all really cool an unique and I love that you can save the ones you like really easily. A First Person Perspective would be really neat if the devs are listening. I'd also love it if they tracked how long a single flight lasts. You crash so damn often in this game, if you manage to stay in the air for more than 40 seconds it's pretty damn exciting and I'd be more interested in beating my last flight time than I am in the high score. Although the score is fun too it would be even better with both.

Bottom line: Grab this game, you won't regret it!

39032038.review:
SuperFlight might be just too simple at first glance, but once you (literally) dive into the game, it turns into something else. It does not have an objective, so you'll have to set one: Maybe skydive into a gap, or make a circuit without crashing, or even fly around just for fun while you're listening to music or chatting with someone over Discord. 

However, you'll notice that while you do that you will be tense and focused on succeding but once you get over it, the feeling of accomplishment and satisfaction takes over you, making all those previous crashes worth the try. It's a game that teaches us to fail and get experienced in order to succeed, just like everything in life.

Unfortunately, you can't make a loop in the air, and the character model could be a bit more elaborated, since the procedural maps are incredibly well-designed with low-poly aesthetics.

[i] " Crash. Put yourself up. Crash again. Learn. " [/i]

39019244.review:
自動生成される浮島の回りをギリギリで滑空するとスコアが加算されていくゲーム。
これだけのゲームですがとても魅力的なゲームです。

【滑空することの爽快さと心地よさと緊張】
滑空し高速で変わる景色、風を切る音、ぶつかってしまうかも知れない狭い隙間を、高速で通り抜ける緊張と成功した後の達成感。ギリギリで滑空した際に鳴るスコアが加算される心地良い音。
これらがハイレベルでまとまっています。

【自動生成される島々のデザイン】
カクカクした岩の塊が組み合わさったような島ができるのですが、これがとても幻想的で魅力的です。
カラフルな島、モノクロな島、小さな島が集まっている島、柱だらけの島、すき間だらけの島と多種多様です。
指定した値を元に自動生成することも出来ます。
プレイ中は島の一番下に落ちるか、遠くへ行く、島の何処かにあるポータルに突っ込むと次の島が自動生成され、島の上から再滑空が出来ます。

【プレイヤーが選べる楽しみ方】
このゲームはかなりプレイヤーに考慮されているように感じました。
このゲームにはコンボスコア、トータルスコアの2つのスコアでランキングがあり、それで上位を目指す事もできます。
ランキングなどが嫌いな人に考慮されているのかランキング表示はかなり控えめで、個人的にはここがかなり嬉しかったです。
島のどこかにあるポータルを探すのもよし、お気に入りの島を見つけるのもよしです。
お気に入りの島に出会えたら保存しておくことも出来ます。
設定のZENモードをONにすればスコアが計測されなくなり、滑空することだけに集中できます。
風を切る音、スコア加算の音、等も調節可能になっており自分の好みの設定ができます。

とても良いゲームに出会えました。

38972516.review:
<> <> <> <> <> Superflight <> <> <> <> <>
==============Pros================
[u]Gameplay [/u]- Pretty simplistic but fun. Swooping around is so relaxing.
[u]Design [/u]- The levels are always familiar yet distinct.
[u]Graphics [/u]- Graphics are pretty simplistic too but charming. The levels look similar but a different coat of paint in every world makes for some pretty awesome scenery.
[u]Sound Design [/u]- There isn't that much in terms of sound here, crashes, the portal sound as you glide from one world to another and the wind whirling as you build up speed. Normally minimal sound would be a negative but here I think it was intentional. The game is relaxing and its peaceful atmosphere benifits from not much sound. Plus if you play your own music it over (like I do), there won't be any clashes.
==============Cons ================
[u]Score System [/u]- I don't have many complaints but I think the scoring is a bit off. Sometimes you can pull off a really tight space or close call and get no points for it. It kind of discourages taking risks when there are no benifits, other than your own satifaction of course!
===========Conclusion================
With a very modest 3 euro price tag, 1.50 on sale right now, this game is a steal. Honestly souring between cliffs while listening to Radiohead or David Bowie's 'Heroes' were some of my most memorable game moments this year. This is the antithesis to the AAA FPS game, this game's fun derives from its peaceful, soothing atmosphere and tight gameplay. As for the games longevity, although there isn't a tonne of variety here, I can see myself returning when I when to passively do something while I listen to a new album or when I just want to chill.
PLAY THIS WITH RADIOHEAD'S 'IN RAINBOWS'. So chill

39423165.review:
Volar por volar. Esa es la definición de este juego.

Te lanzas en caída libre, como si fuera un salto base, y planeas hasta donde quieras. Tan simple como eso. 

Para mí es el típico juego que da gusto jugar en ratos libres, antes de ponerme con algo más serio, o simplemente por desestresarse un poco. 

Los mapas se generan de forma procedural a partir de una semilla que puede ser un número, un texto, etc... y por lo tanto hay infinitos resultados. De hecho cuando juegas si te alejas de las 'montañas' entras en una especie de 'fundido en blanco' y apareces en un nuevo mapa. De ahí que muchos logros sean 'descubrir 25 mundos', 'descubrir 50 mundos', etc...

La dificultad de la partida la marcas tú. Las puntuaciones se consiguen 'jugándotela' a pasar cerca de las paredes, por entre los huecos, buscando portales. Pero nadie te obliga a nada. Puedes simplemente dejarte caer y volar alejado de las piedras para disfrutar del viaje.

¿Vale la pena? Para mí sí, pero es que me encantan los juegos de vuelo libre. El día que hagan un simulador de salto base con un buen motor gráfico renderizando bosques y montañas probablemente seré de los primeros que estén a la entrada de la tienda. Pero igual para gente que busque un juego más 'completo' resulte un chasco. Claro que por el precio que tiene tampoco será un chasco excesivo si al final no te gusta ;)

39415554.review: Proof that Unity games don't have to be trash. I recommend muting the game and listening to some chill music. Maximum sensitivity willl have you clicking keys like a madman, but it also allows way sharper turns which saved me a couple dozen times already. This game has no story or multiplayer, but you can potentially keep a run going for hours if you want to.
